paragraphs.name: 5a33
paragraphs.text: Utter, total freedom. Because it meant that I could do what I wanted and the thing that was holding me back —fear of being seen — just didn’t matter anymore.
Here’s proof.
paragraphs.name: 30cc
2b4b
paragraphs.text: Interesting. So you believe either you’re a lucky unicorn or a shit out of luck donkey? I mean, it’s ok to criticize my work. But you aren’t really giving much in the way of alternative theory.

paragraphs.text: You rock. You nailed my current sitch: I write and few read, then you went on to tell that awesome water park story. That’s brave, even if no one cares, it’s brave to accept yourself. Your daughter is a lucky girl.

e8e9543fabfd.title: I teach writing (writing, not promoting writing) privately and at writing conferences throughout…

paragraphs.text: I teach writing (writing, not promoting writing) privately and at writing conferences throughout the Southwest. Something unsettling happened at the last three writing conferences I spoke/taught at. The students and I were deep in Q&A about writing — inspiration, craft, being blocked, keeping on when one wants to give up. Then a student said…

d11514452326.title: Wow. This hit me hard especially ‘ Write like no one is every going to read what you have to say.

paragraphs.name: eb54
paragraphs.text: Wow. This hit me hard especially ‘ Write like no one is every going to read what you have to say. And then be brave enough to get read anyway.’ thank you for writing this.

paragraphs.name: f65c
paragraphs.text: So. Just checked your profile. You have nine followers and two of your last five posts are basically your comment here…negativity with no solution. If you added “here’s what you can do instead” to your posts, you would see a difference. No luck required.

a7a4d8d77eb2.title: I really enjoyed reading this, but disagree that “no one cared” you spent a day playing at a water…

paragraphs.name: b69f
paragraphs.text: I really enjoyed reading this, but disagree that “no one cared” you spent a day playing at a water park. Your daughter cared. Deeply, I’d guess. Baring yourself to the world can be terrifying and embarrassing and unfulfilling when you think it’s only going to help one person. But sometimes one is enough.

virtuals.subtitle: That said, you sure did offer pungent prescriptions for the craft. I’ll use them in my succeeding posts.

3eaaba7fae34.title: It’s plain truth to “write like no one is ever going to read what you have to say….”

content.subtitle: That said, you sure did offer pungent prescriptions for the craft. I’ll use them in my succeeding posts.

paragraphs.text: It’s plain truth to “write like no one is ever going to read what you have to say….” But in reality we write for people to read; even just for the fun of it.

paragraphs.name: 9b5f

paragraphs.text: I write to write. I do not write to publish or to sell or to be read. I write for me — mostly.
I say mostly because I have come to realize I do want people to read my words, people other than me. I have also come to realize…

155dc49cb00d.title: Thank you so much for the wonderful piece of advice and truly, I agree that the title and content…

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much for the wonderful piece of advice and truly, I agree that the title and content coupled with a good picture matters a lot. I’m hooked reading your piece until the very end because it intrigued me and want to know what to do if nobody bothered to read my writing. I’ll continue to write anyway until I found my bearing and tell the world what I write makes someone smile😊
